org.eclipse.ecf.discovery
Interface IServiceInfo

All Known Implementing Classes:
ServiceInfo
public interface IServiceInfo

Service information contrace. Defines the information associated with a remotely discoverable service

Method Summary
 java.net.InetAddress getAddress()
          Get InetAddress for service
 int getPort()
          The port for the service
 int getPriority()
          The priority for the service
 ServiceID getServiceID()
          Get ServiceID for service.
 IServiceProperties getServiceProperties()
          Map with any/all properties associated with the service.
 java.net.URI getServiceURI()
          Returns URI of service (if available).
 int getWeight()
          The weight for the service.
 boolean isResolved()
          Returns true if this service info has been resolved by the service publisher, false if not.
 

Method Detail

getAddress

java.net.InetAddress getAddress()
Get InetAddress for service

Returns:
InetAddress the address for the service. May be null if address is not known.

getServiceID

ServiceID getServiceID()
Get ServiceID for service.

Returns:
ServiceID the serviceID for the service. Must not be null.

getPort

int getPort()
The port for the service

Returns:
port

getPriority

int getPriority()
The priority for the service

Returns:
int the priority. Zero if no priority information for service.

getWeight

int getWeight()
The weight for the service. Zero if no weight information for service.

Returns:
int the weight

getServiceProperties

IServiceProperties getServiceProperties()
Map with any/all properties associated with the service. Properties are assumed to be name/value pairs, both of type String.

Returns:
Map the properties associated with this service

isResolved

boolean isResolved()
Returns true if this service info has been resolved by the service publisher, false if not.

Returns:
true if this instance has been resolved, false if not

getServiceURI

java.net.URI getServiceURI()
                           throws java.net.URISyntaxException
Returns URI of service (if available). Throws URISyntaxException if existing service info cannot be used to create URI

Throws:
java.net.URISyntaxException
